meanings.definition: To regard or treat with haughty contempt; scorn.
meanings.sent1: She distains anyone who doesn't meet her high standards.
meanings.sent2: He distains those who do not share his opinions.
meanings.sent3: The cat distains the new toy, preferring the old one instead.
meanings.sent4: His distains for authority made him a rebel without a cause.
meanings.sent5: The queen distains those who dare to challenge her rule.

meanings.sent1: Spilling coffee on the white shirt will distains it.
meanings.sent2: Leaving the metal exposed to the elements will distains its surface.
meanings.sent3: The rain distains the freshly painted fence, leaving streaks of color.
meanings.sent4: The gossip distains her reputation, tarnishing it beyond repair.
meanings.sent5: The mud from the garden distains the clean kitchen floor, leaving dirty footprints.
